nl.esciencecenter.xenon

Interface XenonPropertyDescription

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    XenonPropertyDescriptionImplementation

    public interface XenonPropertyDescription

    XenonPropertyDescription contains all necessary information about a property that is recognized by Xenon or one of its components.

    Each XenonPropertyDescription contains the following information:

    • A name that uniquely identifies the property. This name should be used as a key when passing properties to Xenon in a Map.
    • A (human-readable) description that explains the use of the property.
    • The type of values that are accepted for the property (one of the XenonPropertyDescription.Type enum). Even though it is customary to pass the values of properties as Strings, the user should ensure the values can be converted into the expected type.
    • The default value of the property.
    • The components by which this property is accepted (a Set of XenonPropertyDescription.Component). Properties are only valid for certain components of Xenon. For example, some properties may be used when creating an new Xenon, while others can be used when creating a new Scheduler, FileSystem, or Credential.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  XenonPropertyDescription.Component
      The Component enumeration lists all possible parts of Xenon for which a property can be provided.
      static class  XenonPropertyDescription.Type
      This Type enumeration lists all possible types of properties recognized by Xenon.
